Documentation

class Contextable a where

class Contextable : Type class for all the types which can be inserted in a dataset and, therefore, for which a context can be created. it contains a method

Minimal complete definition

autoContext

Methods

generateDataset :: [(Code, a)] -> DataSet a

autoContext : Function that generates a predefined dataset from a list of tuples (Code, a), being a Contextable

generateRelationset :: [(Code, Code, a)] -> DataSet a

autoContext : Function that generates a predefined dataset from a list of triples (Code, Code, a), being a Contextable

Instances

Contextable StvRatio

Contextable instance for StvRatio : The maximum and minimum values are assumed to be the max and min values on the dataset

Contextable StvOrdinal

Contextable instance for StvOrdinal : The maximum and minimum values are assumed to be the max and min values on the dataset

Contextable StvNominal

Contextable instance for StvNominal : The set of valid nominal values is assumed to be the list of distinct values on the dataset

data DataSet a

The polymorphic algebraic datatype DataSet has two constructors: EntitySet refers to data about entities, in this case regions. It contains a parameter v, which is a hash map with the data ordered by codes y a context RelationSet refers to data about relations, in this case links or flows. It contains a parameter rv, which is a list of triples containing the connected nodes and the value. It also has a context parameter.

Constructors

EntitySet 

Fields

v :: Map Code a
 
c :: Context
 
RelationSet 

Fields

rv :: [(Code, Code, a)]
 
c :: Context
 

data Context

The Context algebraic datatype provides information relevan to the data contained in the dataset, such as the maximum, the nominal values... It has a constructor for every kind of data, namely Nominal, Ordinal and Ratio, and a predefined brewerset.

class RetHue a where

The Type Classes for the retinal variables. If a type implements a retinal type class that means that it is appropriate representate it through it. For example a nominal type implements hue but not size.

class RetHue : Interface for the retinal variable hue, also referred as color in the literature. it contains a method hue, receiving a context and a (Maybe) a value for which it will return a color (or a default one if it receives nothing) the method hue' receives an extra parameter explicitely indicating the range of values, which is calculated automatically in the previous one.

Minimal complete definition

hue, hue'

Methods

hue :: Context -> Maybe a -> Kolor

Instances

RetHue StvRatio

RetHue instance for StvRatio : Calculates the hue for a rational value

RetHue StvOrdinal

RetHue instance for StvOrdinal : Calculates the hue for an ordinal value

RetHue StvNominal

RetHue instance for StvNominal : Calculates the hue for a nominal value

class RetLightless a where

class RetLightless : Interface for the retinal variable ligthless or opacity. it contains a method lightless, receiving a context and a (Maybe) a value for which it will return a size (or a default one if it receives nothing)

RetLightless StvOrdinal

RetLightless instance for StvOrdinal : Calculates the lightless for a ordinal value

class RetSize a where

class RetSize : Interface for the retinal variable size. it contains a method size, receiving a context and a (Maybe) a value for which it will return a size (or a default one if it receives nothing) the method size' receives an extra parameter explicitely indicating the range of values, which is calculated automatically in the previous one.

Minimal complete definition

size, size'

Methods

size' :: (Double, Double) -> Context -> Maybe a -> Double

Instances

RetSize StvRatio

RetSize instance for StvRatio : Calculates the size for a rational value

RetSize StvOrdinal

RetSize instance for StvOrdinal : Calculates the size for a ordinal value.

dsToNominal :: DataSet a -> (a -> Int) -> [StvNominal] -> DataSet StvNominal

dsToNominal : This function transforms a DataSet from one type to a Nominal. We provide The original dataset and a function that maps values to Int, ans a set of possible values

dsTransform :: Contextable b => DataSet a -> (a -> b) -> DataSet b

dsTransform : This function transforms a DataSet from one type to another. We provide The original dataset and a function that maps values of the type a to values of the type b. B has to be a Contectable type, that means, either StvNominal, StvOrdinal or StvRatio at this point.

compositeDs :: (Contextable c, Eq b) => (a -> b -> c) -> DataSet a -> DataSet b -> DataSet c

compositeDs : This function combines two datasets into one, through a provided function. We provide a function that receives one param of each dataset, and those two datasets. C has to be a Contectable type, that means, either StvNominal, StvOrdinal or StvRatio at this point. This function only works for a couple of EntitySets or a couple of RelationSets. If a mix is provided, an empty Dataset will be returned.
